A2D4FF4E46BE4F53902EE440FB5E04D8.description:
Advanced: Demonstrate
understanding of relationships
between music and the other
arts, other disciplines, varied
contexts and daily life.

82237C33EB684BA8B8F2981DFE91A25C.description:
Accomplished: Demonstrate
understanding of relationships
between music and the other
arts, other disciplines, varied
contexts and daily life.

9FF663C86F4A4E968B4B90998C9C83B5.description:
Proficient: Demonstrate
understanding of relationships
between music and the other
arts, other disciplines, varied
contexts and daily life.

E8250AC42CD74E7B9271204B589C3FDE.description:
Intermediate: Demonstrate
understanding of relationships
between music and the other
arts, other disciplines, varied
contexts and daily life.

0E544FC0F2014A5A892AB09972C1E7F6.description:
Novice: Demonstrate
understanding of relationships
between music and the other
arts, other disciplines, varied
contexts and daily life.

AF9AC3B46F5C44FCADCFD3A592BB8012.description:
Understanding connections to varied contexts and daily life enhances musicians’
creating, performing, and responding.

60AFD92D32F94C03A13C8FB07BE571D1.description: Connect #11: Relate musical ideas and works with varied context to deepen understanding.

E93FA93B00A24B4FB526AB3682A6D5BF.description:
Advanced: Demonstrate
how interests, knowledge and
skills relate to personal choices
and intent when creating,
performing, and responding to
music.

17685E9D54FE476E816FD89A13992654.description:
Accomplished: Demonstrate
how interests, knowledge and
skills relate to personal choices
and intent when creating,
performing, and responding to
music.

D47F27F213EC4253A741E129F0FCA256.description:
Proficient: Demonstrate
how interests, knowledge and
skills relate to personal choices
and intent when creating,
performing, and responding to
music.

3594CC0317264E51A73E77B389403D5D.description:
Intermediate: Demonstrate how interests,
knowledge and skills relate to
personal choices and intent
when creating, performing,
and responding to music.

56B8AF3D074F40438208167E6A86B8DC.description:
Novice: Demonstrate
how interests, knowledge and
skills relate to personal choices
and intent when creating,
performing, and responding to
music.

12A820E8AB0346C2B100644FEFADE9F1.description:
Musicians connect their personal interests, experiences, ideas, and knowledge to
creating, performing, and responding.

B42AEAAAB6764B4E9EFA5F483BA26945.description: Connect #10: Synthesize and relate knowledge and personal experiences to make music.

CA55DDD82AE649CAAE3BB47527D348EB.description:
Advanced: Develop and
justify evaluations of a variety of
individual and small group
musical selections for listening
based on personally-developed
and established criteria,
personal decision making, and
knowledge and understanding of
context.

D137F7B34FBF417AABEDB8323F03EE96.description:
Accomplished: Apply
personally-developed and
established criteria based on
research, personal preference,
analysis, interpretation,
expressive intent, and musical
qualities to evaluate contrasting
individual and small group
musical selections for listening.

9566066DDBB94677B25C641083AC4D44.description:
Proficient: Develop and
apply teacher-provided and
established criteria based
on personal preference,
analysis, and context
(personal, social, and
cultural) to evaluate
individual and small group
musical selections for
listening.

32938F7B50094984AEFD772BC65F6A6F.description:
Intermediate: Explain the
influence of experiences and
contexts (personal, social, or
cultural) on interest in and the
evaluation of a varied repertoire
of music.

241723BB47D542D1B60A6BD546A5C651.description:
Novice: Identify and
describe how interest,
experiences, and contexts
(personal or social) effect the
evaluation of music.

956AB6295D99457C9553B3295C930585.description:
The personal evaluation of musical work(s) and performance(s) is informed by
analysis, interpretation, and established criteria.

89F563525E054974A6F893A9B900CD45.description: Evaluate: Support their personal evaluation of musical work(s) and performance(s) based on analysis, interpretation, and established criteria.

CA62A7C3B1A14502B7C0AC429732E689.description:
Advanced: Establish and
justify interpretations of the
expressive intent and meaning
of musical selections by
comparing and synthesizing
varied researched sources,
including reference to examples
from other art forms.

15616715A5D04DCA949071AA41AB1B39.description:
Accomplished: Explain and
support interpretations of the
expressive intent and meaning
of musical selections, citing as
evidence the treatment of the
elements of music, context
(personal, social, and cultural),
and (when appropriate) the
setting of the text, and varied
researched sources.

A30925D4B07D4C21A9F292496AAB6AFD.description:
Proficient: Explain and
support interpretations of
the expressive intent and
meaning of musical
selections, citing as evidence
the treatment of the
elements of music, context
(personal, social, and
cultural), and (when
appropriate) the setting of
the text, and outside
sources.

DD5591D496644EAFAD6D931B29011A84.description:
Intermediate: Identify and
support interpretations of the
expressive intent and meaning
of musical selections, citing as
evidence the treatment of the
elements of music, context,
and (when appropriate) the
setting of the text.

2280392E4063481090BE60D61DF33DEB.description:
Novice: Identify
interpretations of the
expressive intent and meaning
of musical selections, referring to
the elements of music, context
(personal or social), and (when
appropriate) the setting of the
text.

F931470C1B4A473E8C4F66D354528014.description:
Through their use of elements and structures of music, creators and performers
provide clues to their expressive intent.

A72CBBFC929644CEB3DC9FE9C16AC6C8.description: Interpret: Support interpretations of musical works that reflect creators’/performers’ expressive intent.i

28D5AEC00B394F8DB09DC64E89C71C7C.description:
Advanced: Demonstrate
and justify how the structural
characteristics function within a
variety of musical selections, and
distinguish how context (social,
cultural, and historical) and
creative decisions inform the
response.

EE56B7E8674C49CC8C5FA6F6B2225B8B.description:
Accomplished: Explain how the
analysis of the structures and
context (social, cultural, and
historical) of contrasting
musical selections inform the
response.

DD3D30BEA15E41768B1D413F09577328.description:
Proficient: Compare
passages in musical
selections and explain how
the elements of music and
context (social, cultural, or
historical) inform the
response.

2D4FCF86A1224E46B69D2192477AD7A2.description:
Intermediate: Describe how
the way that the elements of
music are manipulated and
knowledge of the context
(social and cultural) inform the
response.

B44B1FAE14B24552AB8028069BF4E503.description:
Novice: Demonstrate
and explain, citing evidence, the
use of repetition, similarities and
contrasts in musical selections
and how these and knowledge of
the context (social or cultural)
inform the response.

4E40FEEB797F473F86B7B4E5402ED12B.description:
Response to music is informed by analyzing context (social, cultural, and
historical) and how creator(s) or performer(s) manipulate the elements of music.

279936FD81404F78922EDBCE49E04B21.description: Analyze: Analyze how the structure and context of varied musical works inform the response.

A1D1076E99E84AADA3CC912205CD1A6A.description:
Advanced: Select,
describe, and compare a variety
of individual and small group
musical programs from varied
cultures, genres, and historical
periods.

51B2D7BACB754271AA026BA2CF18B184.description:
Accomplished: Apply criteria to
select music for a variety of
purposes, justifying choices citing
knowledge of the music and the
specified purpose and context.

11B602B1B4524FAD90D03246683F8E01.description:
Proficient: Apply criteria
to select music for specified
purposes, supporting choices by
citing characteristics found in the
music and connections to
interest, purpose, and context.

E0D70EAF9EE24257A684590221A0CE44.description:
Intermediate: Explain reasons
for selecting music citing
characteristics found in the music
and connections to interest,
purpose, and context.

3C1338AC032D4296A8D8908468DA2573.description:
Novice: Demonstrate and
describe reasons for selecting
music, based on characteristics
found in the music and
connections to interest,
purpose, or personal
experience.

2F33A90A989D472BB4570C06187D043D.description:
Individuals' selection of musical works is influenced by their interests,
experiences, understandings, and purposes.

F1B37EE23BFE472FA9D87A578C6A2555.description: Select: Choose music appropriate for a specific purpose or context.

8C0873BF31654BDC8FE6C66F806CAD98.description:
Advanced: Perform with
expression and technical
accuracy, in individual and small
group performances, a varied
repertoire for programs of
music that includes melodies,
repertoire pieces, stylistically
appropriate accompaniments,
and improvisations in a variety
of contrasting styles,
demonstrating sensitivity to the
audience and an understanding
of the context (social, cultural,
and historical).

50895BF0FF114C5D8D0BB0D4268DC175.description:
Accomplished: Perform with
expression and technical
accuracy, in individual and small
group performances, a varied
repertoire of music that includes
melodies, repertoire pieces,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety of
styles, demonstrating sensitivity
to the audience and an
understanding of the context
(social, cultural, and
historical).

0FF5E44C200C4B4AB0B5366DD28DE663.description:
Proficient: Perform with
expression and technical
accuracy, in individual and
small group performances, a
varied repertoire of music
that includes melodies,
repertoire pieces,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns (such as
arpeggio, down-up
strumming, and Travis
picking), demonstrating
sensitivity to the audience
and an understanding of the
context (social, cultural, or
historical).

98468156011C4121B210443BD9340887.description:
Intermediate: Perform with
expression and technical
accuracy in individual
performances of a varied
repertoire of music that includes
melodies, repertoire pieces, and
chordal accompaniments,
demonstrating sensitivity to the
audience and an understanding
of the context (social, cultural,
or historical).

B6874E191F3141E7BB518CA655342620.description:
Novice: Perform with
expression and technical
accuracy in individual
performances of a varied
repertoire of music that includes
melodies, repertoire pieces, and
chordal accompaniments,
demonstrating understanding of
the audience and the context.

C229229DFCC9468E8DE6AE0068AE213A.description:
Musicians judge performance based on criteria that vary across time, place, and cultures.
The context and how a work is presented influence the audience response.

EAA779B73DF449348F0916945D120109.description: Present: Perform expressively, with appropriate interpretation and technical accuracy, and in a manner appropriate to the audience and context..

5F37AC529A70488E968E742F4F9F799B.description:
Advanced: Develop and
apply criteria, including
feedback from multiple sources,
to critique varied programs of
music repertoire (melodies,
repertoire pieces, stylistically
appropriate accompaniments,
improvisations in a variety of
contrasting styles) selected for
individual and small group
performance, and create
rehearsal strategies to address
performance challenges and
refine the performances.

0029EB56B9544B8D8A918293FCA90E0D.description:
Accomplished: Develop and
apply criteria to critique
individual and small group
performances of a varied
repertoire of music that includes
melodies, repertoire pieces,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety of
styles, and create rehearsal
strategies to address
performance challenges and
refine the performances.

DCD887F401D24544A164C1989E31FE0A.description:
Proficient: Develop and
apply criteria to critique
individual and small group
performances of a varied
repertoire of music that
includes melodies, repertoire
pieces, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in a
variety of patterns (such as
arpeggio, down-up
strumming, and Travis
picking), and create
rehearsal strategies to
address performance
challenges and refine the
performances.

6105E795305C4861B95A755DC562DCAB.description:
Intermediate: Apply teacher-provided criteria to critique
individual performances of a
varied repertoire of music that
includes melodies, repertoire
pieces, and chordal
accompaniments selected for
performance, and identify
practice strategies to address
performance challenges and
refine the performances.

B02F4AB513104FCFA36DDA8F51D466DC.description:
Novice: Apply teacher-provided criteria to critique
individual performances of a
varied repertoire of music that
includes melodies, repertoire
pieces, and chordal
accompaniments selected for
performance, and apply practice
strategies to address
performance challenges and
refine the performances.

66CB733D2BFD48C88AC3C342227ECACD.description:
To express their musical ideas, musicians analyze, evaluate, and refine their
performance over time through openness to new ideas, persistence, and the application of appropriate
criteria.

FACB7DC5D91B4039A207447F1AEE1BF0.description: Rehearse, Evaluate and Refine: Evaluate and refine personal and ensemble performances, individually or in collaboration with others.

6B7A171D69944270841F60FD0D414E70.description:
Advanced: Explain and present
interpretations that demonstrate
and describe the context (social,
cultural, and historical) and an
understanding of the creator’s intent
in repertoire for varied programs of
music that include melodies,
repertoire pieces, stylistically
appropriate accompaniments, and
improvisations in a variety of
contrasting styles.

92F7F62073D1446287AE86806D620D18.description:
Accomplished: Explain in
interpretations the context
(social, cultural, and
historical) and expressive
intent in a varied repertoire
of music selected for
performance that includes
melodies, repertoire pieces,
improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in
a variety of styles.

5733D56CC5714BD5A3E8774919846E03.description:
Proficient: Describe in
interpretations the context
(social, cultural, or historical)
and expressive intent in a
varied repertoire of music
selected for performance that
includes melodies, repertoire
pieces, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in a
variety of patterns (such as
arpeggio, down-up strumming,
and Travis picking).

F841B83E3C714572A15B667A0CB43310.description:
Intermediate: Demonstrate
and describe in
interpretations an
understanding of the context
(social, cultural, or
historical) and expressive
intent in a varied repertoire of
music selected for
performance that includes
melodies, repertoire pieces,
and chordal accompaniments.

228C5678AFB64EE2ABAFE4564F228059.description:
Novice: Demonstrate
and describe in interpretations
an understanding of the context
and expressive intent in a
varied repertoire of music
selected for performance that
includes melodies, repertoire
pieces, and chordal
accompaniments.

9F0CE7513935480AA06BCDD9CDEFBD47.description: Performers make interpretive decisions based on their understanding of context and expressive intent.

28802822867648F68F84732994BC1B84.description: Interpret: Develop personal interpretations that consider creators’ intent.

43877700AB1349EBA2EEABFC0F8526EE.description:
Advanced: Identify and
describe important theoretical and
structural characteristics and
context (social, cultural, and
historical) in a varied repertoire
of music selected for performance
programs that includes melodies,
repertoire pieces, stylistically
appropriate accompaniments, and
improvisations in a variety of
contrasting styles.

FFAE8A831C564A36908FFE22D6A7DA48.description:
Accomplished: Identify and
describe important theoretical
and structural characteristics
and context (social, cultural,
and historical) in a varied
repertoire of music that
includes melodies, repertoire
pieces, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in a
variety of styles.

D821382D5AAA44248DD41E5E0DDF5D10.description:
Proficient: Identify and
describe important theoretical
and structural characteristics
and context (social, cultural,
or historical) in a varied
repertoire of music that
includes melodies, repertoire
pieces, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in a
variety of patterns (such as
arpeggio, down-up strumming,
and Travis picking).

7B99A3F3C791477C930AD215D1FCCECA.description:
Intermediate: Identify
prominent melodic, harmonic,
and structural characteristics
and context (social, cultural,
or historical) in a varied
repertoire of music that
includes melodies, repertoire
pieces, and chordal
accompaniments selected for
performance, including at
least some based on reading
standard notation.

283AF0052EC04170ABBE20FD88DF87EA.description:
Novice: Identify
prominent melodic and harmonic
characteristics in a varied
repertoire of music that includes
melodies, repertoire pieces, and
chordal accompaniments
selected for performance,
including at least some based on
reading standard notation.

494348490C9D49DE80C146D68749D851.description:
Analyzing creators’ context and how they manipulate elements of music
provides insight into their intent and informs performance.

68C4CDFF79064DC79E07341C0819D91A.description: Analyze: Analyze the structure and context of varied musical works and their implications for performance.

F7898404BC394744872B52AF0EE73509.description:
Advanced: Develop and
apply criteria for selecting a varied
repertoire for a program of music
for individual and small group
performances that include
melodies, repertoire pieces,
stylistically appropriate
accompaniments, and
improvisations in a variety of
contrasting styles.

0E921E33B6034974B2D0C187E2C11CF5.description:
Accomplished: Develop and
apply criteria for selecting a
varied repertoire of music for
individual and small group
performances that include
melodies, repertoire pieces,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety
of styles.

B38C358E18E041F48A2C8FEEB8AC27A8.description:
Proficient: Explain the
criteria used when selecting a
varied repertoire of music for
individual or small group
performances that include
melodies, repertoire pieces,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety of
patterns (such as arpeggio,
down-up strumming, and Travis
picking).

03E377A95CF040478D86D4A2FEAF6518.description:
Intermediate: Describe and
demonstrate how a varied
repertoire of music that
includes melodies, repertoire
pieces, and chordal
accompaniments is selected,
based on personal interest,
music reading skills, and
technical skill (citing
technical challenges that
need to be addressed), as well
as the context of the
performances.

FAF2370EC7DE4E4992EA8C62298E1594.description:
Novice: Describe and
demonstrate how a varied
repertoire of music that includes
melodies, repertoire pieces, and
chordal accompaniments is
selected, based on personal
interest, music reading skills, and
technical skill, as well as the
context of the performances.

C659317590C7436EA1A101ACED029D3E.description:
Performers’ interest in and knowledge of musical work(s), understanding of their
own technical skill, and the context for a performance influence the selection of repertoire.

944B846BC9D84E03B571D559E9DB71AB.description: Select: Select varied musical works to present based on interest, knowledge, technical skill, and context.

1186E3C7F6C8446A8FB9BAFF985A0BF7.description:
Advanced: Perform final
versions of a collection of
compositions (representing a
variety of forms and styles),
improvisations in several
different styles, and stylistically
appropriate harmonizations for
given melodies, demonstrating
technical skill in applying
principles of
composition/improvisation and
originality in developing and
organizing musical ideas.

77286F798E18495FAE4B572D1D7FD82E.description:
Accomplished: Perform final
versions of compositions
(forms such as rounded binary
or rondo), improvisations,
accompaniment patterns in a
variety of styles, and
harmonizations for given
melodies, demonstrating
technical skill in applying
principles of
composition/improvisation and
originality in developing and
organizing musical ideas.

7BACA2B968754FE088AB9CDB765B4CD0.description:
Proficient: Perform final
versions of improvisations,
compositions (forms such as
theme and variation or 12-bar
blues), and three-or-more-chord
accompaniments in a variety of
patterns (such as arpeggio,
down-up strumming, and Travis
picking), demonstrating
technical skill in applying
principles of
composition/improvisation and
originality in developing and
organizing musical ideas.

8351F61A5F284C5F9E293156231ED0BC.description:
Intermediate: Share final
versions of melodies (created
over specified chord
progressions or AB/ABA
forms) and two-to-three-chord
accompaniments for given
melodies, demonstrating an
understanding of how to develop
and organize personal musical
ideas.

39B13BCA0C774456B4C3F59263364EEF.description:
Novice: Share final
versions of simple melodies
(such as two-phrase) and
chordal accompaniments for
given melodies, demonstrating
an understanding of how to
develop and organize personal
musical ideas.

8F6F9195D1004399B15B174383A7599A.description:
Musicians’ presentation of creative work is the culmination of a process of creation and
communication.

DC2B9796750F44AE8861E678E8F964B2.description: Present: Share creative musical work that conveys intent, demonstrates craftsmanship, and exhibits originality.

2AB7AA862215425E8437815D3F61EF46.description:
Advanced: Develop and
apply criteria to critique,
improve, and refine drafts of
compositions (representing a
variety of forms and styles),
improvisations in a variety of
styles, and stylistically
appropriate harmonizations for
given melodies.

F9F574B235AB4EC1ADF846BD8C4E6778.description:
Accomplished: Develop and
apply criteria to critique,
improve, and refine drafts of
compositions (forms such as
rounded binary or rondo),
improvisations,
accompaniment patterns in a
variety of styles, and
harmonizations for given
melodies.

D8BD8C8F8D0C44788A969878DCB6B192.description:
Proficient: Develop and
apply criteria to critique,
improve, and refine drafts of
improvisations, compositions
(forms such as theme and
variation or 12-bar blues) and
three-or-more-chord
accompaniments in a variety of
patterns (such as arpeggio,
down-up strumming, and Travis
picking).

27C4D0F7D6E14D38A635F4B511B34DD7.description:
Intermediate: Apply teacher-provided criteria to critique,
improve, and refine drafts of
melodies (created over
specified chord progressions
or AB/ABA forms) and two-to-three-chord accompaniments for
given melodies.

1239B9166E9A4C49B2ABACA22A7FADE0.description:
Novice: Apply
teacher-provided criteria to
critique, improve, and refine
drafts of simple melodies
(such as two-phrase) and
chordal accompaniments for
given melodies.

5C8DDEFD51104C7D9B1B9E8080476851.description:
Musicians evaluate and refine their work through openness to new ideas, persistence, and the
application of appropriate criteria.

6DAC3E06706542A29E2A36136A852A7C.description: Evaluate and Refine: Evaluate and refine selected musical ideas to create musical work that meets appropriate criteria.

C65E1D241E5547DCA647370C517D57B2.description:
Advanced: Select,
develop, and use standard
notation and audio/video
recording to document melodic,
rhythmic, and harmonic ideas for
drafts of compositions
(representing a variety of forms
and styles), improvisations in
several different styles, and
stylistically appropriate
harmonizations for given
melodies.

68D2F335D17049FBA249410DE3AD1204.description:
Accomplished: Select,
develop, and use standard
notation and audio/video
recording to document melodic,
rhythmic, and harmonic ideas
for drafts of compositions
(forms such as rounded binary
or rondo), improvisations,
accompaniment patterns in a
variety of styles, and
harmonizations for given
melodies.

59500C61D17D4D01BE113CD04404902C.description:
Proficient: Select, develop,
and use standard notation and
audio/video recording to
document melodic, rhythmic, and
harmonic ideas for drafts of
improvisations, compositions
(forms such as theme and
variation or 12-bar blues), and
three-or-more-chord
accompaniments in a variety of
patterns (such as arpeggio,
down-up strumming, and Travis
picking).

05E8DA05C90A438FA25B3063A93CDE7D.description:
Intermediate: Select, develop,
and use standard notation and
audio/video recording to
document melodic, rhythmic, and
harmonic ideas for drafts of
melodies (created over
specified chord progressions
or AB/ABA forms) and two-tothree-chord accompaniments for
given melodies.

1FB55AC32AC64FB2BA33A6A512B23B35.description:
Novice: Select,
develop, and use standard
notation or audio/video
recording to document
melodic, rhythmic, and
harmonic ideas for drafts of
simple melodies (such as twophrase) and chordal
accompaniments for given
melodies.

656E612A560A49658A57DEF3A1673D15.description: Musicians’ creative choices are influenced by their expertise, context, and expressive intent.

AA0D29EC87474A6E9806FA60B69887DD.description: Plan and Make: Select and develop musical ideas for defined purposes and contexts.

3CF455D4984A4A64875366C15292BDAA.description:
Advanced: Generate
melodic, rhythmic, and harmonic
ideas for a collection of
compositions (representing a
variety of forms and styles),
improvisations in several
different styles, and stylistically
appropriate harmonizations for
given melodies.

1FE179258DFA4ECCBB9DE91534508718.description: Accomplished: Generate melodic, rhythmic, and harmonic ideas for compositions (forms such as rounded binary or rondo), improvisations, accompaniment patterns in a variety of styles, and harmonizations for given melodies.

D87B2B853082472CBE0EFB69D5E4206B.description:
Proficient: Generate
melodic, rhythmic, and harmonic
ideas for improvisations,
compositions (forms such as
theme and variation or 12-bar
blues), and three-or-more-chord
accompaniments in a variety of
patterns (such as arpeggio,
down-up strumming, and Travis
picking).

C5CB56613C08407B93191C67E50A51FA.description:
Intermediate: Generate
melodic, rhythmic, and harmonic
ideas for melodies (created
over specified chord
progressions or AB/ABA
forms) and two-to-three-chord
accompaniments for given
melodies.

15186F83079C41EBAD84E6C5AF5FFB81.description:
Novice: Generate
melodic, rhythmic, and
harmonic ideas for simple
melodies (such as two-phrase) and chordal
accompaniments for given
melodies.

variety of sources.
